title: Adler Da Silva
text:
Adler Da Silva Pereira (born 28 December 1998) is a <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player of <a href="Brazilians">Brazilian</a> ethnic background who currently plays for <a href="%C5%A0K%20Slovan%20Bratislava">Slovan Bratislava</a> in the <a href="Slovak%20Super%20Liga">Fortuna Liga</a>, on loan from <a href="FK%20Pohronie">FK Pohronie</a>.
Club career.
FK Pohronie.
In January 2021, Da Silva had signed a 1,5 year deal with <a href="FK%20Pohronie">Pohronie</a> from <a href="FC%20Stade%20Nyonnais">Stade Nyon</a>, with Slovak first division club having the option to make the transfer permanent.
Da Silva made his <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Slovak%20First%20Football%20League">Fortuna Liga</a> debut for <a href="FK%20Pohronie">Pohronie</a> on 6 February 2021, in a fixture played at neutral ground at <a href="%C5%A0tadi%C3%B3n%20pod%20Dub%C5%88om">Štadión pod Dubňom</a>, against <a href="FC%20Nitra">Nitra</a>. He was featured in the starting line-up and opened the score sheet of the match in the 13th minute by converting a <a href="Penalty%20kick%20%28association%20football%29">penalty</a> set after a <a href="Kilian%20Pagliuca">Kilian Pagliuca's</a> foul against <a href="David%20Bangala">David Bangala</a>. While Nitra equalised before the half-time through Pagliuca, Pohronie regained the lead through <a href="Andrej%20%C5%A0trba">Andrej Štrba</a> ten minutes before the conclusion. Da Silva scored his second goal in stoppage time by converting a counter attack, following an assist by <a href="Alieu%20Fadera">Alieu Fadera</a>. Pohronie gained season's second win. Overall, Da Silva greatly contributed to Pohronie in avoiding relegation by scoring 6 league goals. He became the club's top scorer of the season, tied with <a href="James%20Weir%20%28footballer%29">James Weir</a>.
At the start of <a href="2021%E2%80%9322%20Slovak%20First%20Football%20League">2021–22 season</a>, Da Silva remained goal-less and began some of the fixtures from the bench. His position in the club was made more difficult through the arrival of <a href="Milo%C5%A1%20La%C4%8Dn%C3%BD">Miloš Lačný</a>.
ŠK Slovan Bratislava.
On 2 September 2021, reigning champions <a href="%C5%A0K%20Slovan%20Bratislava">Slovan Bratislava</a> had announced Da Silva's signing, on a year-long loan, followed by an automatic obligation to buy. Da Silva was acquired as a prospective offensive player to aid the club ahead of <a href="2021%E2%80%9322%20UEFA%20Europa%20Conference%20League">Europa Conference League</a> combined with domestic duties.
